segments.text: I guess it began when I was 12 years old.
Now I'm 70, and without knowing in this life, without the knowledge of what is Krishna consciousness,
what was Srila Prabhupada, at the age of 12, somehow or another, I rebelled against the
system which I was brought up into.
I became a vegetarian.
I started searching for the absolute truth.
The Bhagavad Gita tells us that,
three types of persons come to Krishna.
Those who are seeking money, those who are in distress, and those who are seeking the
absolute truth.
So I don't think I fell into the category of those who were seeking money, because I
had a lot of that, and I gave it all up.
It was self-made, but some help from the parents and the family.
And distress, yes, we were all in distress in this material world.
We didn't know which way to go, what to do, our seemingly happiness with our material
life, but actually seeking the absolute truth.
I was looking in the mountains, I was looking in the forests, I was looking in the swamps,
I was living in the ghettos with the black people, I was prompting with kings, I was
living rich, I was living poor, I was traveling from place to place, with vows of poverty,
trying to understand.
And I met what I could call my Bhartma Pradaksha guru.
He was the one, Baba Ramdas.
He wrote a famous book called, Be Here Now.
He had journeyed to India.
Anyways, he introduced me to the Hare Krishna Maha Mantra.
Indirectly.
Indirectly.
And I did that, and we traveled as we did, many people did in that time, among the hippie
communes and things.
And probably first heard of Prabhupada way back in 1968, when he was in San Francisco.
And like this, life went on and on.
And the travels led me to a bus that was in a house that I was staying with.
We were all, a lot of people staying in a house in the house.
The bus had Vishnu John Swami in it.
And he's camped out in our house in Fort Lauderdale.
And we did some park, we did some kirtan with him.
And he was only there a night, so there wasn't much, but what is this, right?
And they gave me a book, a Back to Godhead magazine, which I threw on the bed and it
went underneath the water bed, later it came out, and I dried it and I read it.
And it was a great book.
It was a great book.
It was a great book.
It was a great book.
And, of course, chanting Hare Krishna.
Then again I met him by the will of providence, meeting devotees in different places, not
really understanding, in rock festivals and in downtowns and book distribution, but already
chanting Hare Krishna, but not really knowing anything about the Krishna consciousness movement.
Then again it really began.
I met Vishnu John Swami in 2012.
I met him on Krishna Goswami in a bus, in a park in Phoenix, Arizona.
So they said, when you come to Krishna, you should bring an offering.
So that day we went out with a station wagon, big cars with the back of it.
We went all over the fruit orchards and the flowers and the dates, and we picked them
from everywhere around Phoenix, which is a famous growing area, and we filled up the
whole car.
And we brought it to the, to the park.
That's it.
The park where Vishnu John Swami was.
And we offered it to the deities of Radha Damodar there.
So then Mr. John said, you've made this offering, you have to come now, back to the temple with
us.
So we went back to the temple and I stayed a couple of days with them.
They were leaving for India, early days.
This was probably the beginning of 73 by that time.
Yeah.
And, uh, so that began the journey very shortly, Krishna took me, he took me out of the house
of the rising sun, which is a famous place in New Orleans, we won't get in any details.
And he transferred me to Miami by airplane with a few bodyguards.
And I got to Miami and I had an intimate relationship with it.
My first devotee there, his name was Maha Sringa, he was Bhakta Mike then.
He looked at me.
By this time I had transformed from a long haired hippie with hair down to here.
And I had on a dhoti, which was made out of a sheet.
I had some beads which were tied up into knots by a rope.
I had a sika that was funny shaped, it came down to my back, later became matted.
Yeah.
And, uh, I had some toothpaste which I had used to make tea lock.
And I came from a jailhouse where I was only for 24 hours and the devotees were coming
in, they had been picked up for distributing books.
And they were coming out, they were getting immediately bonded.
And they looked at me, I looked kind of funny, you know, I didn't really look like your regular
Hare Krishna.
And they said, what temple are you from?
I said, I'm from the temple of the world.
And they said, where are you going?
And my brother was there with some of my friends and they said, he's coming with us.
We have a party for him, he's been gone for some time.
And I said, no, I'm going with them.
And they said, yes, we'll be out in 10 minutes, you come with us.
So then Maha Sringa's Bhakta Mike is there.
He looks me over.
Hmm.
What kind of animal is this, you know?
And he gives me a dhoti, he gives me a kurta, he gives me some toothbrush, toothpaste.
That's all I was.
That was it.
There was nothing else.
And he gave me a mat, it was in the Brahmachari ashram.
And he goes, that way's east.
It was 10 o'clock at night.
Everybody was sleeping.
I had no idea which way was east.
That's what it meant.
That's where you put your head when you sleep.
So that began.
And then I said, okay, I'll stay here 30 days and give it a try.
Never left.
That was in 73.
So still to this day, trying to be a devotee, I haven't yet become a devotee, but I'm trying.
Right?
So they asked, when did you become a devotee?
I haven't become one yet.
So during the years, many things, like was funny thing in the very beginning, I was,
I thought that one round was once and back again.
I thought that was one round.
So for the first month I was chanting 32 rounds, right?
And I thought this is hard and everybody was finishing before me.
Then one day I'm watching this Brahman, he's chanting and he gets to one round and he pulls
down the bead.
I watched him again.
He did it again.
He had his beads out too.
I said to him, Prabhu, you're cheating.
He said, what do you mean?
I says, you're counting half a round as one round.
So then he explained to me and then chanting 16 rounds became a little easier.
And then after a couple of weeks they said, you should go out and try book distribution.
And, uh, I said, okay.
Okay.
And, uh, some of our, some of the first devotees that are still with me in Krishna consciousness
to this day, like Abhirama, Adridharana, Mahashringa, they were all there.
We were a big band in Miami.
So they said, you got to go out and try book distribution and you got to put on this wig,
put on a hat, a wig, put on these Garmi clothes, this thing, and you got to go out and distribute
books.
I said, I'll go out, but I'm not going to do all this stuff.
I said, I've changed my life now.
So I went out with my Sankirtan leader and four or five other devotees and they were
all out there and our friend Adridharana was there, but he was dressed up a little bit
and he would point to people and he would say, we're distributing for India and collecting
money for people in India.
And here's one of the people from there that was so grateful to us.
He came back to help us out because I was wearing a dhoti.
So the very first day I went out, I collected more than my Sankirtan leader.
I distributed more books and collected more money.
So they told me, Prabhu, this is your propensity.
This is what you have to do.
But I also had an inclination toward farms and gardens and cows.
So I said, this isn't all I can do, right?
And Srila Prabhupada had given me three personal instructions that I consider personal instructions.
One was to offer obeisances.
That was the first one.
That happened in Philadelphia in the airport in 1976.
I went there to New Vrindavan for initiation three years after I joined, two and a half
years after I joined, because I didn't want a rittvik initiation.
I didn't want it.
I wanted Prabhupada to hand me my beads.
Prabhupada was doing rittvik from the early 70s, right?
And I kept asking my temple.
The temple president thinks I want to go where Prabhupada is and I want to take initiation.
We'll do by letter.
We'll do this, that.
You have to stay here and distribute books.
That's what pleases Prabhupada.
And we were developing gardens for some of the temples and I was sending Prabhupada coconuts
and nim twigs and everything every day when he was touring around America.
We'd climb up the trees and get them in Miami.
So Prabhupada was coming.
I went to New Vrindavan.
I had a Sankirtan party.
We had our own party.
I was the leader.
And I went to New Vrindavan and I told the Sankirtan party, you know, you guys go back
where you came from.
I'm staying here until Prabhupada comes.
You can't.
You're leaving the temple.
I said, I'm leaving.
I'm waiting here for Prabhupada.
I'm not going to go for this anymore, you know?
So they went back and I waited and Prabhupada came and he gave me initiation personally.
That went really well.
So when I first saw Srila Prabhupada, the very first time was when he came into the
airport.
In Pittsburgh.
You got to imagine the airport's a big circle like this.
And on the top, the stairs come out and people come out from the different planes from the
different side, right?
So for months before Prabhupada's coming, Prabhupada's coming, Prabhupada's coming,
he even asked, why is it every new temple, every temple I go to smells like fresh paint?
Everything would always be ready.
And that was the mantra, Prabhupada's coming, Prabhupada's coming.
And we were just totally absorbed in it.
Everything we did was.
We're going to meet Prabhupada, Prabhupada's coming here.
So there was a tumultuous kirtan in the airport.
We could do kirtans at that time in the airport.
And the Radha Damodar parties were there, the traveling parties, a lot of people because
it was new Vrindavan.
It was a big gathering.
And of course there were some other passengers and airport officials around.
So finally Prabhupada walks out.
We're right down there in the middle of the kirtan, right in the center.
Prabhupada walks out.
And.
Yeah.
When he walked out, the whole kirtan stopped.
Everybody hit the ground and did obeisances.
But I didn't.
I'm looking, Prabhupada, oh my God, he's come.
And he goes like this.
Looked straight at me and I was the only one, like this.
So that was his first instruction was to offer obeisances.
And the second instruction I got with him was on a morning walk.
I was tending the cows.
I was tending the cows in New Vrindavan and helping to build A-frames and do different
things.
And we were living up in the old Vrindavan farm.
And Prabhupada came up.
I went on many morning walks in Darshan.
But in this morning walk, I'm standing, there's a lot of pictures, I'm right next to Prabhupada.
And I'm herding the cows, so I got some boots on and got a t-shirt on instead of a dhoti
and everything.
I got a dhoti, but that, so I'm herding the cows.
And this one cow kept hitting Prabhupada like this.
She was a Friesian, she was a Friesian cow, black and white.
She kept nudging Prabhupada.
And Prabhupada was affectionate, pat her on the head and he would smile.
And then Prabhupada turns to, and he says, how old is this cow?
Hari Sori says, she's 10 or 12 years old, Prabhupada.
I said no.
I said, Prabhupada, I'm her cow herd.
She's only four years old and her name is Kalindi.
And she's just started giving milk.
And Prabhupada looked at me directly in the eyes and he says, you must protect, he didn't
say we should protect, he said, you must protect the cows.
Second instruction.
Third instruction, I like to dance.
And I thought maybe Prabhupada would give me a name, something to do with dancing.
And the day before initiation, we were in a Ratha Yatra in Cleveland, but Prabhupada
couldn't go there.
So it came in the front page of the paper, the Rathkart with Lord Jagannath there and
everything.
And somehow in the paper, in the front of the paper, I was dancing in front of the Rathkart,
both feet off the ground, my hands up in the air and my Chatur flying.
That came on the front of the Cleveland Press.
And I was told later by Kulik Shekhar, Prabhupada's disciple, he said, oh, that devotee dances
like Lord Chaitanya.
Right?
So I thought that Prabhupada maybe would give me some Nataraja, I didn't know, right?
So we were outside the barn going into Radha Vrindavan Chandra's temple and we were dancing
like everything.
And a couple of times, Prabhupada looked at me and smiled, right?
It was in Brahmachari cloth, there's pictures of that too.
And you come into Radha Vrindavan Chandra's temple and there's a hallway and two devotees
can be on each side.
And then in the middle, Prabhupada would walk.
So I was jumping up and down, I was right there as Prabhupada would come in just a few
feet and I was dancing like anything and Prabhupada was ready to come in.
And this devotee Charu, he pushes me down, he says, no, you may hit Prabhupada, you can't
dance here.
I said, I have to dance.
And he said, no, you can't dance.
And he pushed me the second row behind.
And he said, no, you can't dance.
And he pushed me the second row behind.
And I said, Charu was his name.
He later had some different qualities.
So Prabhupada walked in and all the devotees were like this.
They were a small kirtan.
Nobody was really dancing when he walked in the hallway, right?
Prabhupada walked over, right next to me, he stopped, he turned, he looked me in the
eyes and he raised both hands, one had a bead bag and one had a cane.
He said, dance.
And he wasn't there when the devotee pushed me behind, but he was there outside.
And he had seen that picture of Cleveland Ratha Yatra.
So that was the third instruction I got from Srila Prabhupada.
Those were direct instructions.
